page.title: 10FARMING: THE LAND
page.content:
Area consists of 60% woodland and waste, and 40% usable land. Farms and holdings from 4 to 260 acres. Steepness makes farming difficult. Up and down ploughing necessary, causing run-off and erosion.
Soil is light loam over shale. Poor quality land, grades 3 and 4, fetching about Â£1000 per acre. Weather very dry. Often difficult to provide water for animals. Intensive grass management necessary. Grassland receives at least 4 cwt. fertilizer per acre each year.
Larger holdings each employ one full- time worker, others use part-time labour. No active wildlife conservation, though Forestry Commission owns and runs one area of woodland.
